Extension Classes¶

class figure_parser.extension_class.OrderPeriod(start=None, end=None)¶

Bases: figure_parser.utils.AsDictable

A dataclass object allowS user to check the product is available for per-ordering or not.

Parameters

  • start (datetime.datetime) – The starting time of pre-order.

  • end (datetime.datetime) – The ending time of pre-order.

Raises

OrderPeriodError – If start is later than end when initialization.

Return type

None

start: Optional[datetime.datetime] = None¶

The starting time of pre-order.

end: Optional[datetime.datetime] = None¶

The ending time of pre-order.

property is_available¶

Is available for pre-ordering for current time.

Returns

Is available for pre-ordering for current time.

Return type

bool

is_available_at(the_time)¶

Convenient method for checking availability of pre-ordering for assigned time.

Parameters

the_time (datetime) – The time that is used to check availability of pre-ordering.

Return type

bool

class figure_parser.extension_class.Release(release_date, price, announced_at=None)¶

Bases: figure_parser.utils.AsDictable

Parameters

  • price (Price) – The product price for the release.

  • announced_at (datetime.date) – The announcing date of the release.

Return type

The product release date.

price: Optional[figure_parser.extension_class.Price]¶

The product price for the release.

announced_at: Optional[datetime.date] = None¶

The announcing date of the release.

class figure_parser.extension_class.Price(value, tax_including=False)¶

Bases: int

Used to record the price is tax-including or not.

Parameters

  • value (int) – Only positive value allowed.

  • tax_including (bool) – Tax is including or not.

property tax_including¶

Tax is including or not.

Returns

Tax is including or not.

Return type

bool

class figure_parser.extension_class.HistoricalReleases(initlist=None)¶

Bases: collections.UserList[figure_parser.extension_class.T]

A list-like container for Release

Parameters

initlist (list[Release]) – Initial data for container.

sort(*args, **kwargs)¶

This method would follow None-release-date-first-with-asc rule when sorting.

Example:

HistoricalReleases([
    Release(release_date=None, price=Price(12000)),
    Release(release_date=date(2020, 1, 1), price=Price(10000)),
    Release(release_date=date(2020, 2, 1), price=Price(12000))
])
Parameters

  • args (list) – Additional arguments for list.sort().

  • kwargs (dict) – Additional key-word arguments for list.sort().

Return type

None

last()¶

If the container is not empty, return last element.

Returns

The last element.

Return type

Optional[Release]
